content: Yes, low-impact endurance exercises such as cycling, swimming, and using an elliptical machine can be great alternatives for those with joint injuries who cannot run. These exercises provide cardiovascular benefits without putting stress on the joints, which can help maintain or improve overall fitness levels without exacerbating the injury. They can also be useful for those recovering from joint surgery or other types of injuries that require reduced impact activity. However, it is important to consult with a doctor or physical therapist before starting any new exercise routine to ensure that it is safe and appropriate for your individual needs.
